name: 27jsteve
text: This business always does a good job.  The staff are kind and helpful.

name: K N
text: I've been using them for years and have been happy with the service. I've never had a problem with any of the cleanings and have never had an item go missing. They've hemmed several pants for us and did a great job. I also had them shorten the sleeves on a few dress shirts, not a run-of-the-mill job, and they turned out perfectly. The staff is always pleasant and professional and turn around for cleaning is usually pretty quick.

name: Peter Lee
text:
I cleaned my clothes at this place all the times
They done great job, I am happy each visited.

name: Joyce Todd
text: The people who own Joy Cleaners are crooks.  I just left there picking up a comforter to be cleaned that was supposed to be ready today for my granddaughter. The woman couldn't find it right away and called for her husband to help. They went in the back looking for it and it was very quiet. Then I heard the sound of plastic. She comes out first 1 or 2 minutes later with my comforter in a bag. I opened the bag before paying to see how well it was cleaned. It didn't look or smell like it had been cleaned. In fact it smelled like it had been buried under other dirty clothes. When I told her it didn't look like it's been cleaned she lost it. She was jabbering away in Korean to her husband, he looked panicked and she was defensive and saying in English that I insulted her.  It was obvious that it hadn't been cleaned and since I was there to pick it up, they put it in a bag and lied to me about cleaning it to get the money. Whoever reads this review PLEASE pass this on tell everyone that you know NOT to take your clothes there. They are opportunists who take advantage of Americans and the citizens of Madison.

name: Erin J
text: New owners are super friendly and helpful. Clothes are always ready on time and they are willing to rush when you need something fast. Wouldn't go anywhere else!

name: Willie Aaron
text: Great place to get your clothes dry cleaned.

name: David Thompson
text: They are a rip off establishment. Charged me $14.00  for some buttons to be placed on jeans and $20.00 for a zipper for my wife’s dress. Really?!!! My bill ended up being $80.00. This is ridiculous. Never going back!!!!

text: Would NOT recommend. Charged me $9.50 and did not clean my dress. The way that I took it to them is the way I got I back they just hung it and put plastic over it . Bad service!!!!

text:
Shady and Greedy Owners
Very overpriced and charged me extra for starch when I didn't ask for it

name: Chuck Cooper
text:
I'm new to the Birmingham area moved here about 4 months ago and was looking for a new dry cleaner. I tried three or four dry cleaners in the highway 280 area and landed on pristine cleaners. The work that they do is fair sleeves on the shirts aren't always wrinkle free, but the price was the least expensive. But recently they lost one of my shirts and their attitude is we don't know where the shirt went, no apology no will try to make it right.
I will never use them again I think their attitude about lost materials and their responsibility for that is nonchalant.

Then when I got the coushins home to put them on the couch- they looked exactly the same. They didn’t even clean them. Asked for my money back, and they won’t get back to me. Steer clear of these people.

When I went to pick them up there were 3 women who ignored  my presence until I said something. Then they continued to talk to each other for several minutes about their personal lives before getting my coasts. Then when I got my coats home and looked at them,  there was still stains on them and you could tell nothing had been done. Do not go to this place.

name: Horatio Murphy
text: New to the area and had to have a suit dry cleaned quickly. They have same and next day service, obviously costs more but worth it.  The staff were professional, courteous and suit came back perfect.  Drive thru service was quick in dropping off and picking up.

resp.text: Welcome to the neighborhood!  Thank you for your business!!!

name: Cindy Bird
text: My son took my crocheted blanket for cleaning. This is a Fisherman's Afghan, queen sized. This is a blanket I made several years ago. It is made from 92 ounces of yarn, 20 skeins. It can not be washed because of the weight when wet. This is the first time I trusted someone to clean it. I am MORE than pleased!!!!! Not only did they do a fantastic job, I found no pulls or ravels. I will DEFINITELY  be using this business again! Thank you for taking such care of my afghan!

resp.text: We are sooo pleased that YOU ARE PLEASED!  We had a conversation with your son regarding this blanket—you are quite talented (and patient) to produce such an item.  Your TRUST in our services is what we absolutely strive for.  Thank you for your business!!

name: Dan Clark
text: The best dry cleaning service ever! Excellent customer service. They don’t use harsh chemicals on your clothing and no toxic smell either. Clothing looks brand new afterwards regardless of age. I’ve had coats, hats and curtains cleaned. They all have turned out impeccable.

resp.text: Thank you Dan, we're humbled reading your review. We truly appreciate you and look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Kaitlyn Dixon
text: When my puppy chewed up a pen on our couch I didn't think it was salvageable. I took it to Complete Cleaners hoping for any help and they did AMAZING. They got nearly everything out & you can't even tell where it was on the couch! I was so highly impressed with their willingness to work at it until it came out, their friendly staff, and the fact they are a green company! Would definitely use them again & again.

resp.text: Thank YOU,  Kaitlyn Dixon!  We appreciate your feedback, and certainly the 5-star review and the very kind words.  We are pleased to serve you any time!

name: Barbara Swader
text: Fast service with a smile. Does a great job 👍 of cleaning my bedspreads.

resp.text: Thank you Barbara! We appreciate the feedback and look forward to your next visit.

name: Atalie Whitley
text: I posted a review on Thursday morning regarding the laundering service at Complete Cleaners and received a call from Alex, the owner, within 24 hours of the review. He was extremely courteous and took time out of his day to follow-up with me after he read the review. He explained the misunderstanding, stating the difference between "laundering" and "wash and dry." Turns out, he recalculated the cost and gave me a credit for $100. Great customer service and care!

name: Sandra Stone
text: Does an excellent job.

resp.text: Thank you, Sandra! We appreciate the kind words and look forward to your next visit.

text: I've been with them since I move to Bessemer over 20 years ago.

name: Keith C
text:
Visited the cleaners a couple of days after having some shirts cleaned, in order to get clarity on my receipt that did not itemize individual costs. When asked for clarity,  the lady became very defensive and asked if I thought I was over charged. I replied,  no I didn't imply that. When I entered the establishment,  I said would jus like clarity. After explaining that polo shirts cost more to clean than button-down-the-front shirts,  that gave me clarity.
It wouldn't hurt if the cleaners let customers  know the cost before leaving the store or have costs posted.

I thought this was to allow the down to settle more fully.  NOW, everytime I look at the comfortable on my bed I get mad.  They had torn the comforter and all the stuffing scattered.  The comforter was destroyed.  Because it was a discontinued pattern, I am now only finding  it online for over $200.00.  DO NOT LET Massey clean your comforters.  Update: I had to buy another comforter at $150.00; they DESTROYED my comforter.

text: Polite and unusually formal employees. I kind of liked their ties and the fresh haircuts. We are using this cleaner whenever we need dry cleaning and haven't had any issues.

name: Edwena
text: I asked for treatment on a blazer and I don't think they did the treatment..looks the same, you know I would've asked but I didn't pick it up

name: Chayse Fuller
text:
I stopped by here because I was very short on time and my usual spot was too far away so I stopped here. I had heard this place was expensive, but I was in a hurry and was willing to pay the extra dollar or so (I thought) per item. When I dropped all of my clothes off I was a little curious why they didn’t want me to pay upfront or even give me a ticket with an amount on it, but it was one less thing to do and at the moment and I was happy to be in and out quickly. All is well.
Fast forward two days to when I go to pick up my clothes and the tell me the total.....$82.52 for 12 shirts and 7 pairs of pants. No silk, fur or leather just cotton dress shirts and pants.
$3.75 per shirt and $7.00 per pant.
Thank god I brought in two weeks worth of work clothes and got my 6th shirt and 6th pair of pants for a penny! Lucky me!
I 100% understand and support paying a premium price for premium quality and/or service. The employees were very friendly and they offer next day pickup depending on what time you drop your clothes off. Unfortunately, next day pick up has been standard at every dry cleaners I have ever used and, for the most part, so has friendly employees. I honestly can’t see how anyone who has been there and had to pay for their services would go back.
In summary: don’t go here. Literally, go anywhere else that is open and near you and save 40-50%.

name: tbravado1
text: I've ignored several broken buttons and starch marks on shirts until they managed to completely fry a shirt that was only months old. The shirt literally tore open from over starching and over-pressing. I waited weeks for "corporate" to review the damage and their explanation was that "Shirts wear out" and offered no compensation for their mistake. Taking my business elsewhere from now on!

name: Rapheal King
text: Great service

name: Mattie Bohanan
text: If you go, be sure to pay ahead!! I got quotes for $17 when I dropped off dresses. I what the option to pre pay, but I figured I would just pay when I picked up. When I came back, they tried to charge me $41! Thankfully I had my original receipt/quote, so when I showed them, they investigated and said it was initially put in wrong. So, to compromise, they took $10 off, leaving me with a $31 bill. I really don’t mind paying the value and am thankful they happily took the $10 off, but I also think that you should honor whatever price you initially promise..

name: Telea Marie
text: I brought in my comforter and when I got it back it was lumpy. Like, the stuffing has clumped together and, in other areas, it is thin (sheet to sheet thin)... Stupid me for thinking that they could wash and care for my comforter better than I could🤦🏽‍♀️🤦🏽‍♀️

name: Kristy Lucas
text: I have used these cleaners in a limited capacity, mostly for the convenience and their location. However, I have received a few items back in worse condition than I dropped them off in. I could have done a better job myself. I will look for a better quality cleaner.

name: APD3984
text: If you use Professional Cleaners in the Kroger shopping center, I would caution you to change dry cleaners. My wife dropped off items to be cleaned, including my suit jacket, slacks, dress shirt and a couple of dresses back in January. The clothing was then lost. Every time she has gone into check on them, they claim there is nothing in their system showing she dropped anything off. Unfortunately our claim ticket was misplaced, so we have no “proof”. She has never once been able to talk to the owner or store manager. I went in two days ago and got the same run around. I asked to speak to the owner or manager and was told by my the two women that their boss, Anthony, is never there. They copied my list of lost clothing and took my number. I’m still waiting for Anthony to call me and discuss my $600 worth of clothing. It’s no wonder they have multiple reviews on Yelp with only one star.

name: Kim Harlin Hays
text: They have lost my husband’s suit, 2 Calvin Klein dresses and my business suit. And nothing listed in their computer. Puff they disappeared!  We should ban together and place a civil suit against them. May have to make signs and picket outside cause it’s time they have real answers and pay up!!!!!  They deserve Zero Stars!!!

name: Abby Kuhn
text: I took my comforter and 2 shams here to be cleaned. I was told they would be ready the next day. When I came back, the shams were in a pile in a rocking chair by the door. They told me they weren't ready and to come back. I gave them two more days and then came to pick everything up. They seemed to struggle to find it. They asked, "You had 2 shams, right?" I said yes and they handed me everything in a large bag tied up. When I took it all out at home, one of the shams was missing. I called that night. They don't have voicemail. I called again the next day (Thursday) and was told The Manager would call me back. I left my name and #. On Monday, I called again and was told the manager would call me. On Tuesday, I stopped by and asked. They took my name and # again. They said a manager would call. I did get a voicemail from the manager on Wednesday asking me to call her back. I did and she was gone. I still haven't heard from anyone. No explanation or apology has been offered. I would have been fine with an "Oh dear, I am so sorry we lost it/ate it/or whatever fate befell my sham." Now I've lost a discounted sham from Anthropolgie and it's wrecked my whole bed set. I was patient and kind with the employees ; however, this is the worst customer service experience I've had in Auburn.

name: Zach Taylor
text: I have used Professional Cleaners 3 or 4 times and they have never disappointed. They get the job done quick and their prices are very cheap! Would recommend!

name: Kaye McDonough
text:
On November 30, 2018, I dropped off a pair of valances (curtains) at Professional Cleaners near Kroger in Auburn.     They destroyed the items, yet charged me! Now the owner will not even discuss this with me.
I have tried multiple times to talk with him! This is 1/14/19 and still no response from the owner, Anthony.
Kaye McDonough

name: Rebekah Evans
text: I took a comforter there, and made them aware there was a stain on it. I came back and picked it up, paid them the $25 and took it home. After I opened it, the stain was still there and it smelled exactly like it did when I took it. They made no comment about not being able to remove the stain, just handed it to me like nothing was wrong. I took it back and basically got a “too bad so sad”. Very disappointed in the professionalism and lack of customer service. Will not be returning.

name: AU Bowhunter
text: I have been taking shirts and suits here for years now. Probably to the tune of $400 a year, but no more... I just left this place and the lady working the front was completely rude.  She was mumbling under her breath at the number of shirts I dropped off (15 maybe) and she just shouted “tomorrow at 4pm!”  When I asked if I needed my tickets, which I get every single time, she snarled “No you don’t!” That isn’t the first time. Recently, I had a stain on a white button down shirt that was clearly caused during the dry cleaning process and simply requested they treat and re clean. I wasn’t angry or rude, just simply wanted them to fix the issue.  The same lady pretty much implied I was lying as if they were above making a mistake like that. Her attitude sucks! I am finding somewhere else from here going forward!

name: Tania Cobine
text:
Put a dress in to be cleaned, went to get it and they said I had picked it up, which considering I still had the slip to get it was pretty amazing. A 200 dress and they were not even apologetic said they would get the manager to call 3 days after the fact.
Update - still waiting for a call from the owner 5 days later.

name: Nick Derzis

I called stressed out and these lovely people made sure one pair was done in time so I didn’t go to work pantless! Price is unbeatable as well.

name: Jeffrey Hunter
text: Ok

name: S. Chumney
text: December 30, 2017. I’ve been going to T&H Cleaners for over 3 years now and I have had only one issue out of those few years. The owner went over and beyond the call of duty to rectify the issue ASAP and he made sure that I was a satisfied customer! I can’t speak highly enough of the owner for making things right. We need more business owners like T&H that actually care about their customers, instead of themselves. I highly recommend T&H Cleaners to those that are seeking great dry cleaning services here in Mobile, Al.

name: john gilbert
text: T&H is awesome.  I took my Coca Cola Polar Bear costume their to be cleaned and they did a fantastic job. Tiffany was especially helpful as she helped was able to figure out how to get part of the costume apart for cleaning.  Reasonably priced and I would definitely recommend them for clothing and costumes cleaning. I already use them for my dry cleaning and will now use them to clean the costume.  Thank you again Tiffany for top notch customer service.

I've always had great service using T&H Cleaners. I would recommend them to everyone! QUALITY OVER QUANTITY!
PLUS >>( GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE)

name: Eric Karr
text: I took my two laboratory coats to be dry cleaned. When I received them back it looked like nothing was even done on them. They were still wrinkled and now they have brown burn marks all over them. They essentially ruined both of my white coats. The press marks were not naturally laid either, one of them was so unnatural they burned it into my white coat. I would NEVER use this dry cleaner ever again. I know these marks were not here when I dropped them off because I dropped them off BRAND NEW out of the package. Worst dry cleaner I've ever been to

resp.text:
Hi Eric,
I'm sorry to hear about the problems you are having. None of this has been brought to our attention. Can you bring it by the cleaners to let us look at it? We press many lab coats everyday but never had any kinds of burns. Hope to hear from you soon.

name: Vu Le
text:
I sent a custom tailored suit in, as well as a standard white shirt, for dry cleaning and it was picked up by my girlfriend. The shirt still had obvious stains on the collar, so she left it to be cleaned again. The suit however, has somehow been ruined. It looks as though it has been put in a washer machine; the cuffs are somehow coming inside out as I wear it, and the lapel is wrinkled. There was also a stain on the back collar of the suit that I was able to take off by scratching at it.

I haven’t had any issues with dry cleaning before  and I tried this business for the first time, right before a wedding. I wish I had just waited for my usual shop to open up instead. Extremely dissatisfied.

resp.text:
Mr. Le,
I’m sorry for the problem and would very much like to bring resolution to the matter. I’m unable to locate your info in our computer system. Could you please call my office at 706-323-7774 when get a chance or send me your contact info?
Thank you.
Rhonda Eysel

name: Sa'Vaughie French
text:
I dropped off a garment to have a strap fixed on Monday as was told that it would be ready by Wednesday. It is now Friday and it's not ready. I needed this for a trip I'm taking this weekend.

Edit. Thank you to the owner for reaching out to me , personally, on Friday. It's refreshing to know that my business is important to your company. The situation was rectified and I was able to have my clothing in time for my trip.

resp.text: Ms. French, I am so sorry your garment wasn't ready when promised. I appreciate you taking my call on Friday, June 5th and am glad we were able to have it ready for you to take on your trip. We appreciate you. Kindly, Rhonda Eysel

resp.text: Thank you, Yvonne!! We appreciate you!!

Thank you, Robert for choosing Master Kleen Dry Cleaners! We appreciate you, the positive review and the recommendation! Kindly,
Rhonda Eysel

text: Absolutely ruined my $500 comforter and took no responsibility and even charged me dry cleaning fees for ruining my bedding! Do not take your dry cleaning to this horrible establishment!

text: My wife dropped my dress shirts off to be dry cleaned. What I got back looked horrific...seems more like I paid them to vandalize my shirts. They all had to be ironed before I could wear them. Terrible job. Will never return.

resp.text: Sorry to hear that please comment the manager and what location was it we are here to help in anyway possible

name: Suzanne Bernheim
text: Normally, I do not have a problem. BUT, if you ever do, the owner will not do a thing or budge. So I only continue to go for laundered shirt prices. He obviously doesn't know about customer service.

text: For 15 years, we have had good experiences with Legacy Cleaners.

name: Michelle Matlock
text: Beware of these crooks! This cleaners messed up several of my garments and are not skilled in cleaning silk fabrics. They shrank my silk dress and top by 3”. I tried talking to them and wrote them, and they refused to pay my damages and said they don’t have insurance to cover it. They are not honest and don’t understand customer service. They don’t deserve 1 star and the 5-star rating came from the owner himself! Go figure. I’m headed to small claims court to hopefully recoup my money.

resp.text: Hopefully you are happy Miss Michelle after receiving settlement of your dress.

name: Daniel Gallegly
text:
Nice quality and consistent.
The owner is very courteous and nice and the workers are always happy.

I like their customer service very much.

name: L Rogers
text:
I dropped off six shirts. Nothing fancy just light starch. I got them back all hung and in plastic as you would expect. I took three of them with me on a business trip and when I went to put the first one on it had these horrific brown stains in the back. I check the others and one of them also had stains but in the front.
Upon my return I took them back in and told the very pleasant young lady at the counter what happened. She apologized and said they would redo them for free. I also dropped off a coupe of other pieces.
Next day I pick them up and not only are the stains still there but there were more stains. The owner refused to do anything about it and said it was my fault. I immediately took my shrts to another cleaners close by and explained what happened. To my dismay she proceeded to tell me other customers that had the same experience. One the same day I picked my cleaning up before my trip. They also had the same experience with the owner. I would recommend staying away from this business. This guy has no clue what the words CUSTOMER SERVICE mean in America.

resp.text:
Mr Perthel,
My name is John Massey (johnmassey@jimmassey.com or 334-481-1928). I apologize that our Westminster location did not have the 5th piece ready for pick up when you went by Friday afternoon. No excuses. I see in our computer system that the 5th piece was completed and bagged and sent to the store Friday morning. I am afraid the garment was sent to the wrong store. We are conducting a store by store inventory until we locate the garment. Again I apologize for our mistake. Someone will notify you as soon we have the garment in hand. Of course there will be no charge for this garment.
Again, I apologize for our mistake.

Mr Perthel,
The store personnel located the garment and it is at the Westminster location. I have instructed the personnel to not charge you for the item. That is the least I can do. Again I apologize for the inconvenience.
Sincerely, John Massey

name: Jonathan Handjis
text:
This is an email my wife sent to royal cleaners after having her purse sent there:

Hi, I just recently sent my brand new suede, leather purse there to be cleaned. It had some ink stains from dark wash jeans that I wore that had rubbed off on it.  I was going to try to treat the purse myself at home, but unfortunately I made the mistake of assuming that a professional cleaner would be able to do a better job than me!  I assumed wrong! It looks as if someone stuck it in a washing machine! I was not aware that leather products were cleaned in this manner and assumed that a real life person would examine it and treat it appropriately! My husband picked it up for me today, so I was not there to voice my complaints myself, and he didn't examine the purse to see the damage.  Not only is the purse completely discolored and dried, it is also broke.  The metal prongs beside the straps have come loose from being put in a machine! I only used the purse once, so they shouldn't have been loose from use! I am so horrified and completely disappointed in the service that I received from you! I will be sure to let everyone know what an awful cleaning company you are and warn them about doing any business with you!

name: lauren jones
text:
Very poor customer service. At the VERY least, get off your phone, look up, and greet the customer walking into your store. Will not be back.
Also learned they send the clothes off site to be cleaned. Nothing done in house. And don't be fooled by the drive thru--they will stare at you peering over their phones until you realize that is their kind way of saying "I'm sorry, despite this being a drive thru set up, we are not a drive thru cleaners. Please come inside to drop off your clothes."

I did some Google searching for self-care tips and found that I could wash it myself in the bathtub using a special down cleaner and it was not recommended that I dry clean it. I went back the next morning to pick it up and cancel the cleaning and they brought it up cleaned! The man that does the actual cleaning knew the correct procedure for cleaning it and he had started on it right away. They turned it around in less than 24 hours.

text: I have been using Worth Cleaners for several years and continue to be impressed with their quality, service and friendly staff. Usually visit them on a weekly basis to either drop off or pick up. Their email notifications are helpful also. During these unusual times the management and staff are doing everything they can to make sure everything runs as smoothly as possible.

name: JaKierra Lee
text: Awesome fast service

name: m stoup
text: Efficient! Friendly! Priced right!

name: Kimberly Lewis
text:
I went to this location on November 7th to see of they would clean an area rug. The lady that checked me in looked at the rug, consulted with another worker that was there at the time, gave me a ticket, and told me that the rug would be ready around the same time the following week. I called on November 14th to check the status of the rug. I was told "Yes, the rug is ready, but we couldn't clean it." I asked her why did anyone not call me to let me know that it could not be cleaned? Basically all I got was an "I don't know" and some other pathetic excuse. I immediately proceeded to pick up my uncleaned rug that has just been sitting on a table for an entire week.
For the entire life of me, I do not understand why something as simple as a phone call did not happen. As soon as they saw that they could not accommodate, all they had to do was call and say, "We apologize for the inconvenience, but we cannot clean your rug." I would have happily returned to pick up my rug and found another company to clean it. I am pretty sure that someone knew that Friday morning after I dropped off, that they would not be able to clean my rug. But NO, the rug just sat there until I called to check on it.  A simple phone call. Communication, communication, communication. Inconsideration and/or laziness. But regardless, there was absolutely no reason why I was not contacted. This was my first and most definitely my last visit.

name: Tony Drake
text: The folks at Worth Cleaners on Vaughn Road are like family.  They hustle to get me in and out as quickly as possible since I come in on my way to work. They are always pleasant and always happy to see me.  The clothes are always clean and starched just like I like them.  I couldn't ask for better service.

name: Kaleigh Flatt
text: By far the best dry cleaners in Montgomery! I have had items ruined at some of the other dry cleaners in town and charged an arm and a leg by the others. I like that Worth Cleaners posts their prices on their website so I know how much everything's going to cost before I go. Plus their staff is super friendly. I would definitely recommend Worth Cleaners.

name: Cecilia Ike
text: If you do not care about your clothes and want them ruined, you have come to the right place. I recently purchased 2 pretty gowns for my daughters, they wore it to one family occasion before we sent it to worth cleaners. They tore one and used their dryer to shrink the organza fabric overlay of the other one. They returned the clothes without mentioning anything about the damage(very fraudulent people) and when I asked them about it, they stated that they only followed the instructions on the care label, that I needed to go back to the store where I bought it (belk, 21 days ago) and complain to the manufacturer about the wrong care label. Seriously......for even the torn outfit? I don't understand why these scammers are still in business. I left the 2 gowns with them and they are yet to contact me 3 weeks later. There are so many credible laundry services out there, do not make my mistake!!

resp.text: Dizzy, we are very sorry to hear about your experience. We strive to give every customer that walks through the door the best possible cleaning service and we are sorry that you feel that wasn't the case. Please reach out if you would like to discuss this matter any further. Thank you, Worth Cleaners.

text:
The customer is always right, except at Aladdin’s Cleaners.
I had a brand new white dress with red cherries.  I loved my new dress.  I wore it once to a wedding.  After reading the cleaning label I decided to have it professionally cleaned instead of hand washing it because I loved it so much.
BIG MISTAKE.  HUGE.
My new dress was ruined in the cleaning process.  Tim, the owner, refused to take responsibility stating that I brought it in stained (which is NOT true) and that he would not “buy the dress.”
I am a 34 year old physician.  I do not bring in stained dresses for dry cleaning and try to trick the business into buying me a new dress.
DO NOT TAKE YOUR CLOTHES TO THIS CLEANER.

name: Lisa Martin
text: I was on vacation here in Birmingham, was referred by the person working behind the desk at the hotel lobby where I was staying.  Took my clothes to this cleaners, was told they would be ready on a certain day, ask for a receipt for my clothes, was told they don't give out receipts because the customers either lose or forget to bring their receipts back. Went to the cleaners on the day they said they would be ready was told one of my items was back but the other two weren't.  Called the next day I was told my r 2 items were taken to another site because a machine broke down. Called the next day was told they couldn't find my two items. I told the ladies I was going to report this cleaners to the Better Business Bureau and take them to small claims court if they didn't find my clothes. Called two days later and was told they left a voice mail the following day saying they found my 2 items.  When I got there and the lady handed me the the pants they weren't mine, they were men's pants that had  a P logo on them. My pants were on the right side of the rack there was a paper attached to the plastic over my pants. Written on the Aladdin's paper it had on it EASTWOOD and gray 506. I told the ladies at the cleaners they needed to give me a discount, the older caucasian lady said the next time. I told her that it won't be a next time, she says to me okay then, it won't be a next time. I told her I wasn't being smart aleck with what I was saying to her, I let her know that I don't live in Alabama, I was on vacation. She told the lady to take the amount off for my pants. When I was paying for my two items, the lady at the register ask me if I was serious about reporting the cleaners to the Better Business Bureau and taking them to small claims court, I told her, I was very serious and that I was going to also call the local news station and report how nonchalant and blase they were when I was calling asking about my clothes and their customer service. I told the ladies, I ask for a receipt and didn't get one, that i didn't have anything to do with customers forgetting or losing their receipts. That in the future if a customer ask for a receipt, they need to give them a receipt.  The older caucasian lady started yelling at me to just leave, I told her, I'm not talking to you like a child, don't talk to me like a child. The older caucasian lady yelled at me again to just leave. I said to her and the other lady GOD bless you all and walked out the door. In all my 50 plus years on this earth, I have never experienced treatment like that from any business.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text:
Customer service is hit or miss — I’ve had great and bad service from this store frequently.  I took in a brand new suit from a Mt. Brook retailer — so new I asked them to remove tags (tags were not removed). When I got the clothing home I noticed a tear in the front of one of my sleeves. One could not possibly miss it. I returned immediately. They first suggested I must’ve torn it on the ride home (no tear in bag). Then they suggested that it was pre existing (to which I pointed to the tags) and then I asked the most logical question:  if it is so noticeable by anyone who handled the garment, why wasn’t it tagged somehow when it first went in to get cleaned? Something should have been done but nothing ever was nor did I ever hear from any managers.
Bottom line, though, is that they’ve been around a long time and do decent work — even when they make mistakes.

1. I don't rip off the plastic coverings to each item from the dry cleaner as soon as I get home. I open them when I'm getting ready to wear them under the assumption that they are pressed and cleaned appropriately.

2. I do have more than one shirt and jacket in my closet. The assumption that I should've already worn this suit jacket earlier than a few weeks later is foolish.

name: Lizbeth Skrobis
text:
Customer Service is not their specialty.

I dropped off clothes on Wednesday morning through the drive through window.  The lady said it would be done on Friday. I asked for delivery service so I had to go inside and fill out a form.  Then there John or Jason said it would not be ready until Friday, which was fine since I will be out of town but there will be someone at home.  On Thursday night I received an automated voicemail at 9PM; that they would be delivering and picking up clothes on Friday.  Friday comes and goes with no delivery so I called at about 3:00 trying to find out what the problem was.  I was informed by an employee named Katie, that my clothes was ready but there would be no further delivery because "everyone left for a family graduation" the graduation for the owners son.  She said that she would leave a note to see about delivering on Saturday, that, "it shouldn't be a problem".  On Saturday we called to find what time they would deliver and no one was ever informed and that they don't deliver on Saturday.  My husband had to go to pick up the clothes and was told there was a shirt not ready.  He was told that they would deliver the missing shirt on Monday.  On Monday we called about the shirt and was now told that they do not deliver to our location until Tuesday.  We got the shirt on Tuesday and John (or Jason) called my husband to say the shirt was delivered, trying to apologize.  Unfortunately I had to call him back because he told my husband things that were totally wrong.
The bottom line is that this business has a very long way to go to on customer service.  Family companies are great but there is no reason that one order should have so many untruths told in order to cover up for the fact that they left on Friday.  Additionally, all employees need to be able to talk to the companies policies, even if they are only part-time employees.  Because of these problems, we will definitely not be returning and everyone who asks (and some that don't) will hear about our experience.

resp.text:
Dear Mrs. Skrobis,
We apologize for the miscommunication on our side of the issue.  We tried to handle this as professionally as possible and we are sorry you weren't satisfied with our service.

Sincerely, Josh Watkins- Mgr

name: Mark Landers
text: Mark's is professional- consistent quality and care!  Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Landers! So thankful that you have trusted us for the past 16 years! Thank you for your loyalty!

name: Sophia Cowan
text: Mark's does a consistently excellent job with my clothes.  They always look great, and my clothes are ready when they are supposed to be.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I will continue to send my clothes  to Mark's Quality Cleaners and recommend Mark's to friends.  I have had no complains from my many friends who also use Marks.

resp.text: Thanks Sophia! I'm glad we were able to fix what others couldn't.

name: Amy Self
text: Marks was quick with pick up and delivery. It's nice to not have all that laundry to do.

resp.text: Thank yo so much Ms Self! We appreciate your kindness and allowing us to serve you!

name: Justin Hardy
text: Best job ever!! Always on time and good pricing, too

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Hardy! We are grateful for your business!

name: Madeline Harris
text: Kind and result as expected.

resp.text: Thank you! I hope we exceeded and changed your expectations for a dry cleaners!

name: David Walsh
text: Great quality and customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Mr. Walsh!

name: Andy Reinaker
text: Pretty disappointed. Asked if they could remove 2 easy stains from 2 shirts, same day. They said no problem. Picked up shirts with the same 2 stains later that afternoon. Owner offered a "tiny discount" but otherwise didn't seem to care that the shirts were still in the same unwearable condition they were left in.

resp.text:
Mr. Reinaker,

I am so sorry that you weren't satisfied with our service!  We strive to treat every garment the best way possible but your shirts needed more time and it was explained when you dropped them off.  Since, your garments were dropped off at our cutoff time, 9:30am, and needed back three hours later by 12:30pm, they were not able to receive the attention needed to remove the stains you had in them. We pretreated your shirts for the stains but in order to meet your deadline needs it was not possible to achieve perfection. We would be happy to do them over for no charge at all but we would need the time to soak them since the stains are set in. Next time you are in a time crunch give us a heads up and we should be able to help you out or send to a respectable clothier to dress you with a few shirts.

Sincerely,
Josh Watkins
Owner

name: G Weldon
text: Excellent service and quality!

resp.text: Thank you for all the years of loyalty Ms. Weldon!

name: Solar Reflections Sales
text:
Everyone at Mark's Cleaners are nice and courteous! Really nice family to do business with!!! I have never heard any negative comments about their work.
April

resp.text: Thank you! You guys are a pleasure!

name: Millie Foust
text: I love the service you get with Marks!  They always do agreat job and really go above and beyond!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Mrs Kimbrell! It's a pleasure doing business with you!

name: John Jeans
text: It's always a good experience!

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Jeans! It's always a pleasure to see you!

(Original)
Gracias Ms. Arevalo!

resp.text: Thank you!!!!!

name: Amelia Burbank
text: I took a coat here recently and this place could not get the stains out.  The girl at the counter tried to keep charging extra per spot....very pricey. Will not go back!

resp.text:
Hi Ms Burbank, I'm sorry we couldn't remove the stains from your coat, if you want to bring it back we'll attempt to remove them for free. Also, we don't charge any extra for strains or stain removal, we remove them as part of our normal process. Please bring it back and I'd be happy to make another attempt!
Josh
Mgr

name: Marriet Maina
text: I accidentally dried my boyfriends memorable jacket with a green pen and completely ruined it. Ken's cleaner's were able to quickly and effectively remove all the pen stains in a day! They are Miracle workers and I  Highly recommend there service!

name: Tricia Gantt
text: Very reliable and reasonably priced

name: redheaded stepchild
text: Clothing is cleaned, pressed and back on time. Sonja or John greet you at the drive up with a smile and remember your name. Excellent customer service. Highly recommend. Reasonable prices.

name: Stephanie's Haulidays
text: Do not use!!! Dropped off 3 dress shirts. Given a time to pick up, not ready, come the next time, still not ready. Come back again, get home only to realize they weren’t cleaned but pressed!!!! They actually pressed dirty shirts and gave them back.

name: Chip Dawson
text: I have lived nearby for 15 years and used this dry cleaner/laundering service under its previous ownership(s). I was well satisfied; however, John has made it worth the five stars.

name: Terry Wasden
text: Excellent Service. The team goes out of their way to ensure the quality is the best possible.

name: Trina Janay
text: HORRIBLE!!! I dropped my dress off on a Saturday said i needed it on the following Wednesday said they would have it ready can you believe they called me Wednesday (TODAY) saying they can’t do it?? THE DAY U NEED IT!! If you are looking for a huge inconvenience then yeah GREAT!

name: Chris Prosser
text: I get my shirts cleaned here on a regular basis. There is one lady that works there that is extremely nice and helpful. She knows me by name without me saying anything and knows how I like my shirts done.

name: Casey M
text: This has been my dry cleaner of choice for over a decade. They are professional, efficient and excellent. They always deliver as promised and have helped me on a last minute, 24 hour turnaround one time when I was in a crunch.  I can’t speak on the pricing because I don’t have anything to compare it to, but worth the ease and convenience no matter what.

name: Peter
text:
These people are awesome. They really take pride in their business, and ensure your clothes are properly cleaned and expertly pressed. I’m pretty sure they replaced a button on my shirt one time, which was a pleasant surprise as most cleaners don’t even care.

I don’t live in the area anymore, but I’m seriously considering taking a bi-monthly trip to have my clothing done. Highly recommend!

name: Quality Shoppe
text: Nu-Kleen has a proven track record of knowing how to clean even the most delicate bridal and formal wear.  We trust them enough to recommend them to our customers.  We are grateful to have their years of cleaning knowledge right here in Jacksonville.  They are always a pleasure to work with!

name: cindy lang
text: Good work for a great price. The work done by good people. Home owned and operated.

name: Bill Stone
text: Great job and good price

name: Will Hallman
text: Looking forward to doing business with them tomorrow!

name: Cutler Knupp
text: Guy does it right. On time and always quality.

name: Alex Henderson
text: Owner is extremely nice and clothes are ALWAYS ready for pickup within 24 hours. They offer drive thru and will gladly load your clothes. Great prices. Very humble people.

name: Charles Kim
text: Awesome quality

name: Laura Holton
text: They do great job on the Hawaiian shirts my brotherIL wears for work!

name: Christopher H
text: Giving them a second chance.

name: mia smith
text: my dad has been bring his clothes there for some time now and every time he goes he’s very happy with how they do his clothes. also when i drop his stuff off for him the workers greet me with a smile. 10/10 recommend

name: James Kennedy
text:
My fiance went to pick up my clothes that were dropped off on Thursday,  we were told that the clothes would be available on Friday. We had some bad weather on Friday so we understood that they wouldn't be ready on Friday. When she went to pick them up on Saturday, she was told that my clothes were not even on site and would not be. When she asked when my clothes would be available to be picked up she was told that it would be Monday and that they had no even been cleaned yet. She explained that was not acceptable since we have an Event to attend this evening and the clothing being cleaned was specifically for this event. She told them that she would take the clothes, cleaned or not because it was important that we had these items for this event. The person that she spoke to was very rude, would not give her his name, nor would he give her the information of management. After going back and forth with them for 20 minutes and them threatening to call Hoover Police on her they finally provided her with the address and location where my clothing could be picked up. She made the drive to another location to retrieve my items, when she arrived at "Smith Cleaners" where my clothes were, they were in fact CLEAN and READY to be picked up by Calgon. Their customer services is hideous. The ONLY reason that I chose Calgon was because of the great experience I have had with their Owners at the Trussville Location. I will No Longer Use Any Calgon due to this experience. I will also be reporting this to the better business bureau as well and also I will be in contact with the Owner, through a family friend, to let him know how his business is operating while he is out of town.

We could have been much more understanding and pleased very easily had this location handled business in such a way that their other locations do.

Worst Experience Possible.

name: RJ Johnson
text: So we have been using this dry cleaner to launder husband's dress shirts for the past five years beginning when we first relocated to Hoover because of their pricing being so competitive. We continued to drive here after we relocated to Pelham/Alabaster for almost 3 years now. Despite the fact that almost every time we have dropped off my husband's shirts, they've had to be redone TWICE because they were NOT clean on the collar or cuffs. But yet they continued to starch and press them when it is always clearly visible that they're NOT clean. We drop off around 10 at a time & we pretreat them each time in an attempt to get them clean on the first try so we don't have to make useless trips. His shirts are only worn once prior to cleaning. So we go this week to pick up last weeks drop. And as usual they have to be redone. We have tolerated this until... I go in and when I check to see if they're clean & they are not, the young lady says to me the owner said that if you want your shirts done "PERFECTLY" then you need to dry clean them but they will not be relaundered. & we would have to pay $4.25 per shirt for that! I show her the cuffs and asked if she could see the grime still present & she repeated her statement. The other person assisted and said she would send them back to redo as dry cleaning because we had paid. Then my husband gets a phone call not from the owner but from one of the high school students, reiterating to him that if he wants his shirts done "PERFECTLY" that he needs to pay to have them dry cleaned. Now, we see just how much they #1 first and foremost don't care about their image, or the quality of their work. #2 the impact on the environment. #3 losing the business of a committed long term customer relationship. Since our weekly 25 minute commute from Alabaster/Pelham is not appreciated by this dry cleaner we will find another one.

name: Leighia Barnes
text: It feels like family everytime I pick up my fathers clothes!!

name: Kaitlyn Hill
text: IF YOU WANT THE WORST POSSIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER GO HERE, BY FAR THE WORST SMALL BUISNESS ENCOUNTER I HAVE EVER EXPERINCED. Not quite sure who let these children with no manners at all behind their counter but they need to be fired asap, as I was walking out one yelled “don’t come back” and I’ll assure you I’m not going back EVER. I’ll also make sure that all of my friends and family know not to use this place either. If their was negative stars I’d choose -10000000. I’m just appuled by the way I was treated not only as a customer but a female. So again I’ll say DO NOT GO HERE

name: Jamie Estes
text:
DO NOT USE THIS CLEANERS !!!!
We’ve been using this cleaners for 5+ years. We spend anywhere from $30-$75 a month.
I picked my shirts up the other day and a new shirt that I wore once had holes in the front.  I brought it in to the store to show them what they had done. They said someone would call us about it. I told them that the shirt was $35. They told the owner and he told his manager that he would not replace it or give us credit with the store because there was no way it was the cleaners fault.  VERY VERY POOR customer relations !!!
NEVER AGAIN WILL I USE THIS CLEANERS and I recommend for everyone to do the same !!

name: Kerry Anthony
text: Very good service. A little pricy though.

name: Antoinette Smith
text: Please don't go there please bad job and no good cleaning

name: Ahmad Alexander
text: The employees are nice and have great customer service. They have your clothes ready on time and you have the option to pay when you drop them off or pick them up.

name: Penny Butler
text: Been with them since 97

name: Birmingham-Stillman
text: Great!

name: Brenda Woods
text: Alterations were the less any other cleaners

name: Mary Holmes
text: Need a new person to press, owner pressing not good.

name: Marcus Bogus
text: Did good job

name: Jamie Bessette
text: We have used this company for our dry cleaning for over ten years and never had an issue until just recently.  My husband’s brand new suit jacket was returned to us with a burn hole in the shoulder.  After several emails to discuss reimbursement they replaced the jacket.  I would recommend this dry cleaner. No problems, good prices.

name: Jon Lucas
text:
Despicable business. I have been going to Kim’s for 2 years and have not had any major complaints. I brought a suit in to be cleaned and when I picked it up the coat was full of holes and tears. The shirt I dropped off with this suit was also covered in black grease.

I returned both items only to wait a week before anyone contacted me. When I finally got to talk to the manager (Josh) he told me the material was defective and denied all responsibility. He then says he will talk to the owner about refunding me and I wait another week with my calls never being returned. Today 11/13 I talk to Josh and once again I’m given the run around. All the sudden the owner calls me and asks for a receipt from Men’s Warehouse and which location I bought it from... ? I will provide this information and see where it goes from here.

Fox 6 On Your Side is highly interested in running a story and if this isn’t remedied by the end of the week I don’t see any other option. I will edit this post if by some miracle they decide to do what is right and refund me for the damage they caused.

Stay very far away from this business.

name: Jill Lucas
text: We have been customers for about 2 years. They ruined a very expensive suit and collared shirt and did not apologize once or offer to make it right. Instead, made up wild scenarios as to what could have caused the damage (i.e. the suit came in covered in gasoline !!!!!) I am not kidding. You get what you pay for here - save your money and your time. Go somewhere else.

name: Remy Helu
text: They do great work

name: Nat B
text: I wouldn't do buisness here, rude interaction.

name: Bradley Dale
text: I have been a customer for several years now. I have always been pleased with the customer service and the quality of their cleaning. I wouldn't think of taking my cleaning anywhere else!!!

name: Fayzie DeCastra
text: I had been a loyal customer for several years unit I took my motorhome curtains in to be dry cleaned and pressed.  They came back a wrinkled mess.  When I showed the owner and asked if they could re-press them, he was so rude I will never go back.

name: Marcus Wright
text: Perfect for all my sewing needs

name: Reginald Cook
text: It's a great place to get cleaning products

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Friendly and helpful

name: Kimberly Harmon Miss Kim as Aretha
text: Young lady there was nice, but she couldn't help me. Wasn't her fault at all. Will go back.

name: Kurtis Graben
text: Friendly staff, great prices and quick turnaround.

resp.text: Kurtis, thank you for your kind review, we look forward to seeing you again.

name: David Dunlap
text: This was a great experience and the best customer service I’ve had since moving to Birmingham a couple of years ago. It’s nice to find someone that will go out of their way to help you when you’re in a jam. I usually don’t write reviews but this time deserved one and I’m happy I have a new cleaners. I’d waited last minute to get a suit cleaned for a special occasion with my family and the cleaners I’ve been using said it was too late for same-day service. I found Park Place Cleaners and they said they would be glad to help me out. Picked my suit up that afternoon and the service/quality/friendliness was awesome. I will definitely be back. Thanks again for the help.

name: Amy Martin
text: I recently had a major red wine stain on a down comforter that sat for 4 months in storage before I was able to take it to be dry cleaned. I didn’t have a lot of hope that the stain would come out but they got it out!. I know my clothes are in good hands. I’ve sent stuff to this same owner for years and wouldn’t consider using another place.

name: Brian Moore
text: Greeted with a smile. Location was very clean and neat! Drop off and pick up was so easy. Great cleaners! I won’t go anywhere else!

name: Bill Anderson
text: Worst and most disrespectful customer experience I have ever had.  Suit not ready when promised, which I needed for a key meeting.  I was told it would be comped (fair enough). Returned 3 days later to pick up and employee working said full price, no record in system of being comped, and tough.  I explained the situation, offered the individual’s name I spoke with regarding the comp 3 days earlier... and I was told: Deal with it.   REALLY?! The employee was not going to contact them and offered zero help and maximum attitude. So I, the customer, called the person at the Vestavia location I originally spoke with about being comped in the first place and left a message.  Meanwhile the employee just looked at me, offering no help and plenty of attitude.  So I left.  I was called back by the Vestavia location and said it should have been comped and to return tomorrow to pick it up... MY THIRD TRIP.  So recap (1) not ready when promised, (2) extreme attitude when returning to pick up when ready, and (3) a third trip now required to pick up.  Unacceptable.  Avoid unless you enjoy being treated horribly.  I normally don’t take the time to rate and post details, but this was so bad, I felt compelled to document in hopes it saves someone else such an incompetent and disrespectful experience.

name: Glenn Arnette
text:
Park Place Cleaners on Weatherly Drive pays close attention to the details, while they go the extra mile to make sure I am satisfied with my cleaning needs. The staff is very friendly and are very helpful when I visit.
I highly recommend them!

name: Brenda Torres
text: I brought my comforter a few days ago with a  spot on the front and they did such an excellent job taking it out! Great staff and service!

name: Donna Birkhead
text: Debra is always pleasant as soon as you walk in. The service is prompt and the clothes are always clean, even those spots you think won't come out. Love our Weatherly Park Place Cleaners!

name: Matt Copeland
text: Had an emergency and needed to have my suit cleaned and pressed immediately and they were super helpful. They even went out of their way to return it same day even tho it was technically past the cutoff time (usually before 8am)

name: Richard Mizell
text: Friendly service and quality work. I'll definitely use them again.

name: Thomas Spruce
text: They do a great job at a reasonable price.

name: Noboru Eguchi
text: Nice cleaner with great employee. Thank you for your service!

name: WTGardner
text: Great cleaning and extremely courteous staff. Only place I trust!

name: Becky Burns
text: Friendly, excellent service and they do a great job!  I will be back!

name: gary rathbone
text: Have gone by twice door locked with sign on the door will be back in 15 min. That's no way to run a business.

name: Matt Tomberlin
text: Great service and employees.

name: Heather Franklin
text: Excellent service

name: Pedram Maleknia
text: Every time I have been to Royal Fine Cleaners, they have been nothing short of professional. The service when you walk in the door is impeccable, and I feel like family every time I go in. I appreciate their work, and I hope wherever I go to school next has a dry cleaning business as good as this one.

name: adam pitts
text: Royal Cleaners is the best dry cleaning service in town! I had left a suit there over a year and they held on to it! Also wasn’t charged any extra fees. Fast, friendly, and professional!

name: Katherine Webster
text: I love this dry cleaner! They always have my clothes done by the next business day, and their prices are extremely reasonable. I've been coming to this location for about a year, and I can't recommend it enough.

name: Kim Hawkins
text: This cleaners is the worst place for alterations! Do not use them! They took over a month to put in a zipper on a skirt. They originally said it would be $24 and then charged $25. Yeah, I know it's just a dollar, but they should be giving me a discount for my troubles, definitely not charging more. The guy said they send alterations out to a company that does high volume and isn't interested in doing one skirt-- would have been nice to know that over a month ago, buddy.

name: Alex Lee
text: Friendly staff, and my clothes always done well

name: AntShell17Bee3141
text: I'm Always satisfied with the  friendly service and timeliness. I wish it wasn't as pricey but there are not many choices in town. It's convenient for me most of the time. I do spend at least 3 days a week in Opelika. I haven't ever received any discounts, coupons, or rewards, for being a consistent customer. It might be something worthwhile for them to invest in to keep loyal customers coming in. I spend a lot of money a month on dry cleaning and laundering larger linens.

name: Owen Jackson
text: Good job hemming my pants

name: Kelly Meacham
text: Have used them a few times. They were able to remove stains that no one else could.

name: Kelly E
text: Nice

name: Vikki Miller
text: No waiting and very clean. Does great work!

name: Micah Harris
text: They do an excellent job for my family. The young lady that works the counter is always so nice and courteous. Thanks!

name: Bill Scott
text: Always do a great job

name: Paul Hopper
text: This cleaners has taken good care of all my garments entrusted to them over the past 5+ years. I've not had any issues with their service. The staff has always been courteous and professional.

name: Louise Marble
text:
DO NOT LEAVE YOUR CLOTHES HERE!!!!!!!!

This cleaners lost my fiancé tux in Aug which my fiancé needed for a wedding and other events.The clerk told us to buy another and we would be reimbursed. Fiancé purchased another and had it altered to fit.It cost $500.In Dec
We were notified that the original tux was returned by a customer and therefore there would be no refund for the new one! I left messages for the owner and he will not return.

This man owns 3 or 4 dry cleaners in the area and doesn’t have the money to reimburse a customer??

I gave one star because you can’t leave a review unless you leave one!

name: Clara Hayes
text: Terrible service. They told me my clothes would be done in 2 days. I go to pick them up and they say the truck is broken and it won't be fixed for another week! I had to go buy a new outfit for my job interview! And did anyone bother to call me? Of course not! Never going back.

name: Joshua Beaman
text: I needed my suit cleaned for a wedding, of course I waited until the last possible minute, but All baldwin was able to get it cleaned and pressed in less then 24 hours. Great customer service, reasonable prices. They have been in business for as long as I can remember and I will continue to use them for any dry cleaning needs I may have.

name: Robert Legg
text: Even though the lady couldn't help me,  she still gave me a solution to my problem

name: Papa Elmo
text: They keep my uniform clean, and have not lost it one time. Thank you!!

name: Karen Prescott
text: Best place to have your clothes dry cleaned in Foley.

name: Butch Foster
text: They lost our dry cleaning for a few days

name: Light Light
text: the best store

name: Alonzo Carrillo
text: These people ruined my shirt

name: Dana Kruckenberg

name: Beth Jones
text: Tried to go at 3:00 on a Sunday afternoon. Both change machines were broken. Finally got enough quarters to do laundry and went back only to be told that they were closed. They now close at 4:00. The lady in there told me they will open back up at 8:00 on Monday morning, so basically anyone that works 8-5 can’t do laundry there.

name: Michael Shaw
text: Staff is friendly, facility is clean, but most of the dryers have been broken going on 2 months now.

name: Danielle Smith-Atkins
text: The 🚺 ladies that run or work this laundromat are so sweet to me. The quality of the machines and making sure it's comfortable in there is what they do best at this location❗ If in need I go there until my washer is fixed! Thank you 1-Stop Laundry♨❗

name: Dewayne Baggett
text: Got a beautiful woman works there blond

name: Betty Pomante
text:
Just left this business after doing laundry.  We are traveling and was told this was a good laundromat...NOT.
Many washers and dryers were not working and several dryer sheets were on the floor by the dryers.
It just felt like it needed a very good cleaning and equipment needs work.

name: sean lee
text:
No problems . nice staff
Only complaint is the washers are real slow filling up if you set it for hot water.

name: Chandra Bozeman
text: Friendly staff..overall clean..several of the washers and dryers are out of order but overall decent laundromat..convenient location near Walmart in Northport

name: Nakkia Smith
text: The laundromat is clean. However staff is very rude. I asked the attendant does the change machine works. She shook her head NO and started back doing what she was doing. So I’m standing there looking crazy like well what do your customers do about change. Some guy had to walk up to me to let me know that they give us change out of a bucket if we asked. Smh that was very very unprofessional of her long head ahh!!! Thankful for my new washer cause I wouldn’t have never gone back to 1Stop!!!!!!!

name: Jacqueline P
text: great laundromat! i come all the time and know the attendants. they never cause problems and only snap back when are provoked so needless to say i think some of the reviews are from nut jobs who don’t have anything better to do, especially blaming everything on another adult! will continue coming in and do my clothes. nice workers and clean place, minus the nut jobs that occasionally come in here to do their clothes

name: Tammy Kizziah
text: I've been working here for 5 years now an the rules have been the same, that nothing thicker than a sheet is supposed to be washed in the small washers. I dont understand why people think if they cant wash their bedding or rugs in their washers at home why they think they will fit in the small washers there. The small washers an dryers are new an they're already starting to wear down because of people overloading them an not being considerate of the new equipment. As far as the Attendants,  we do our job an try our best to take care of our customers an the equipment to the best of our ability.. we strive on making our facility a nice, clean, an friendly atmosphere to accommodate all your laundry needs. So please do not think we're being rude when we ask you to gently close dryer doors or not drop washer lids we're just trying to make our equipment last longer so our laundromat will be at your disposal for a very long time. Thank you for your business an we hope to continue being your 1 stop laundry

name: Marcie Avans
text: Nasty, dirty place! It made my skin crawl! It's dark and dingy and so filthy!! 1 Stop Laundry is the closest laundromat to my house,  but after going there once, I've made the decision to travel the half hour to a laundromat in Tuscaloosa.  If I could give it ZERO STARS I would!!!

name: Kym Nelson
text: Nice people working there. Decently clean. Can watch TV while doing your laundry.

name: RandomActsChapter4
text: Undoubtedly the most well-maintained and well-staffed laundromat I have ever been in. We just moved to the area and I was thrilled to find this place. 👍👍

name: Linda Conner
text: All washers good...dryers perfect, customer service is awesome!!

name: Jade Skye
text: New rules everyday. You never know what the new rule will be. Been washing my clothes there for 3 years. Now I'm told my fleece blankets are too big for a regular washer. Which is ludacris. A lady who obviously just started said they were too thick? They are not even as thick as denim. Its annoying she does not have common sense to tell a blanket from a comforter. Now I have to wash my tiny blankets in a massive $6.00 washer that they also use to "dry clean" everyones comforters. Which barely works. (I have paid the $50 for dry cleaning and its pathetic) So there is always a line. The attendants will tell at you for closing doors to hard. They care more about smoking cigerattes outside then anything. Hostile place to wash your clothes. I do not recommend.

name: jami martin
text: Most people work 9 to 5, when you get off you do things like wash laundry, not here. If you get there at 5:35 they will turn you down even if you are just using the washer. I understand they dont want to be there past 7 but they need to not false advertise and say they close at 7 when they technically close at 530. #pleasechangebusinesshours or be considerate of the working class.

name: Michelle Aschton
text:
This place is awful. All large washers, except 1 - out of service.
My son and another woman, were drying their clothes.
30 mins before closing, they had both put a final quarter into their dryers to finish their loads.(6mins)
The woman attending the place came over and STOPPED their dryers.
Made them remove their clothes.
When the other woman questioned why she was making them leave 30mins before closing (they'd been there since 5PM)and they had JUST put their quarters in - she was told *Too bad*.

When I arrived at 15mins, until closing  - my son was sitting out on the curb.
The doors were locked and the attendant refused to even look up.

Not at all professional and a really horrible way to do business.

name: Melissa Flowers
text: Understand that the posted hours arent what counts, if you cant be in there by 5:30, they dont want your business.

name: Judy Powell
text: Nice, clean, friendly, new IPSO  machines, good location, and AC. 👍👍👍👍👍

name: Zariah Cross
text: I am a UA student. I like this place because it's right by Walmart and the Dollar Tree so I can get my shopping done and do my laundry. Also the staff was very nice each time I visited. I just wish the seats were more comfortable and that maybe there were tables to do my schoolwork. Also adding Wifi would be nice.

name: Tracy Plowman
text: Very clean and great customer service 👍😊

name: jamorris brown
text: Good clean place with brand new washer and dryers

Mr. Furmanek,
When I read your review I wanted to call you to apologise for whatever happened that upset you.   I looked up your name in our computer system in all our locations but cannot find your name.   Perhaps that was your first visit and your information had not been entered in our system.  I'm sorry if you had an unpleasant experience, we have wonderful employees and it is very rare to have a complaint about our customer service.

name: Joanne Villaflor
text: In Dec. 2014, I dropped off an article of clothing at cleaners to be promised within 3 days. The article of clothing is a tailored Ann Taylor Trouser valued for $98. When I arrived at cleaners to pick-up article of clothing the employee at Tri-City cleaners, 280 Bypass, Phenix City location, was unable to give me any information as the article of clothing could not be located. I told her I would return later in the week for follow-up. A week later I arrived at cleaners to pick-up article of clothing and the employee states she has tried multiple times to contact the owner and the owner did not respond to her emails/phone calls regarding the lost pants. I returned to the cleaners to resolve the issue, was given owner’s contact information to directly communicate with her as the employee was not given a response from the owner regarding my lost article of clothing. I phoned the owner and left a voicemail re: communication on article of clothing. No phone call returned. Currently I do not have my article of clothing or compensation for lost article. Although the employees were kind and apologetic, the family owned business has an owner who lacked customer service and follow-through. Highly recommend going elsewhere!

text: I dropped my wedding dress, 3 pair of white pants and 3 white shirts off Wednesday. They ruined the 3 pair of white pants on Thursday!! Someone supposedly washed the pants with a black and white suit and the black got all over the pants. They were not able to get them clean so it a total loss. Sad part is the shirts and pants were only there to be pressed (everything was brand new). I went to get my dress and shirts Friday and my dress wasn't even steamed. It was wrinkled I had to ask they to steam it while I waited. I could tell it wasn't steamed because it wasnt even hung correctly on the hanger. I would never go back to this establishment and wouldn't recommend it to anyone either. Super cheap prices and super poor service!!

Recieved a call 45 later asking was I taking my pictures inside or outside and that the wrinkles will fall out when I put my suit on and if I wasnt satisfied i could come by to speak with her Friday and that she would not be able to come in to fix even though I took the pictures later that day. name: Stella Dallas
text:
Take a picture of your clothes before you take them here.  On separate occasions I have taken PLEATED shirts or dresses to be dry cleaned and they IRONED OUT all the pleats.  The latest set of items I picked up smelled musty and will have to be hung outside before I can wear them.  I am very unhappy with this company.

Update: I just realized why I stopped using them years ago.  I spend 30 to 45 minutes matching my clothes and organizing them for the dry cleaners.  When I get them back from Massey's, they have intentionally MISMATCHED all my clothes so I can't even find an outfit for work.

A clothes organizer advised me to color code my closet and my entire weekend has been spent trying to match up clothes based upon texture, designer, size and so forth.  I will NEVER use them again.  Perhaps hire PROFESSIONALS who know good and well a cloth red skirt would not be matched with the radon fabric jacket of a totally different color and size.

DO BETTER!

resp.text: I am very sorry that the items were not to your liking.  Please bring them back to the store and we will be glad to redo them at no charge.

name: Carol Roberts
text: I rarely get anything dry cleaned if I can help it, but my daughter had a very expensive prom dress she wore once and I wanted it cleaned. I took it to this location because I suspected they are the most reliable, and they are. They quoted me a reasonable price and then gave me several, much appreciated discounts. The service was excellent and friendly. The manager was there taking care of customers. The dress came out nice and is well stored. Good service all around.

resp.text: Thank you Carol, for letting us know about the great service you received. We appreciate you choosing us to care for your valuable garments.-Tina

text: If you have any expensive clothes please don't get it dry cleaned here. I had my 300 dollar Leatherman jacket coat cleaned her and got it back with a rip, and on top of that I get charged for them not being able to properly clean the jacket. Worse dry cleaner I been to yet!!!

resp.text: Mr. Logan, we sincerely apologize for your experience. We are looking into it and will have the store manager call you as soon as possible.

name: Mike Jackson
text: Been a customer at this location for many years. Have put up with issues and poor service (a few good people but few). Final straw was when I was charge 8 for a shirt to be laundered when it should have been 3. Worker told me she couldn't correct prices. Was offered a refund the next day on a phone call but to many issues will take my business to another cleaners

name: UnbiasedReport
text: I was told by my alteration shop to call a dry cleaner to see about getting my dress steamed. This was the very first time I've ever called this place and I was met with someone who doesn't know the answers to any questions. My one question was, how much is it to steam a wedding dress? She put me on hold for several minutes and then came back saying that they would have to clean it. I was lost because I didn't need a cleaning. I needed my dress only pressed for the wedding. I explained to her that the dress had not been worn yet, so I'm a bit confused as to why they needed to clean it first? The girl on the phone didn't care at all and advised me to call the manager back tomorrow so that she can tell me what I need to do. In my mind, I'm not calling back, especially after calling the other location and them telling me that is $154 to steam my wedding dress when Worth cleaners is only $64! Jim Massey's cleaners is highway robbery! When I asked the lady why is it so much when their neighboring competition is less than half that price, she only told me that they take 30% off of the cleaning which makes it $154. That's ridiculous! For that I can take it to my bathroom and turn the hot water on and let the shower steam it.

Probably a great place for quick "normal" dry cleaning. The place was clean and seemed efficient, but maybe for more difficult cleaning or fragile items, go elsewhere.

text: When your are in the insurance and financial services business two things are true... you need to look crisp and professional, and that time is of the essence. A Waite's Cleaners employed ghost swoops in for pick-up and delivery and the correct charges are made to my account on file.  Heck yea.

name: JN91B14 007
text: I've been using dry cleaners throughout Mobile for the past 20 plus years and I can tell you that none of them can compare to Waite's Cleaners. The level of customer service is 2nd to none and accountability from management is phenomenal to say the least. They even provide pick up and drop offs for people who have weekly needs. I believe they are locally owned and operated. They make me feel like a truly valued friend from the staff on site, to my delivery man Alex and of course there's Clifford! Give them a try, you won't regret it!

name: Amy Bedsole
text: Highly recommend this company for laundry needs as well as dry cleaning. We have never been disappointed. They do excellent work.

name: Bob Wood
text:
Have used Waite's for over two years after a couple of negative experiences with another cleaners in Mobile.  Always professional and reliable; recommend them highly.

2021 Update:  Nothing has changed...EXCELLENT personal service.  Pickup and delivery twice a week.  Superb service from suits to shirts to dresses to window treatments to blankets and comforters.  You owe it to yourself to try Waite's if you haven't done so yet.

resp.text: My goodness... that blew me away! Thank you so much for taking the time to write these amazing words... we are SO thankful for you!

name: Judy W
text: I can't say enough great things about Waite's Cleaners.  First of all, they are a first rate company that provides an excellent service.  The owners are a well-known and respected local family and they treat every customer like family too!  But, beyond that, the free pick-up and delivery is awesome.  We moved our offices to a high-rise building in 2013 and I can't tell you how convenient it is to have Waite's bring the cleaners to us instead of having to navigate getting in and out of the building/ parking garage/etc., to drop off/pick-up dry cleaning (or anything else, for that matter).  Waite's Cleaners is a timesaver for sure!  Everyone associated with Waite's has the best attitude, friendly service and always pleasant to deal with.  I recommend Waite's for all your dry cleaning needs!  They're the best!

name: Bragg Van Antwerp
text: Clifford and the entire team at Waite's are the absolute best. They go above and beyond to make sure their customers are happy, to handle special requests, and they do it with unfailing professionalism, courtesy and enthusiasm.
